pullRequest.body:
The orders of summands in some lemmas are changed and simp annotations are added to make the API closer to the one for lists.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [fcfcee2e71](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19546/commits/fcfcee2e71fc47bd71947135a25e1a4cf7f3ef4d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ append_eq_cons`
`+ append_left_injective`
`+ append_right_inj`
`+ append_right_injective`
`+ append_take`
`+ cons_head_tail`
`+ drop_append_of_le_length`
`+ get_append_left`
`+ get_append_length`
`+ get_append_right`
`+ get_cons_append_zero`
`+ map_take`
`+ take_add`
`+ take_append_of_le_length`
`+ take_drop`
`+ take_get`
`+ take_prefix`
`+ take_prefix_take_left`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thank you. Besides the necessary changes I did some very easy cleanup. However, I'd prefer to leave the consistent naming of variables etc to whoever cares about the inside of the file and not just the public API
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12759628710/job/35563709724)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12759628710/job/35563709930)
Hi! Thank you for developing `Stream'` API. I left some stylistic comments for you.

Looks good to me, thanks for the PR. I suggest

maintainer merge
Hi! Thank you for developing `Stream'` API. I left some stylistic comments for you.

Overall it seems reasonable to align the API of `List` and `Stream'` as much as possible.

There is further cleaning-up of this file which could be done, like using consistant variable names, not using `\forall` in conclusions, etc, but this might be out-of-scope for this PR. This relates to the comment about the `variable` command, but this should be no blocker. If you address the comments about `left_injective`/`right_injective` and the `Stream'.eta` I think this PR can be merged

Looks good to me, thanks for the PR. I suggest

maintainer merge

This is the only place where the `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Group.Nat` import is needed. You can use Nat lemmas (namely `Nat.exists_eq_add_of_le` and `Nat.add_assoc`), which allows you to avoid `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Group.Nat` and remove the annoying "large-import" label. :)

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨m, hmâŸ© := Nat.exists_eq_add_of_le h
  ext k; rcases lt_or_ge k m with _ | hk
  Â· rw [get_drop, get_append_left, get_append_left, List.getElem_drop]; simpa [hm]
  Â· obtain âŸ¨p, rflâŸ© := Nat.exists_eq_add_of_le hk
    have hm' : m = (x.drop n).length := by simp [hm]
    simp_rw [get_drop, â† Nat.add_assoc, â† hm, get_append_right, hm', get_append_right]
```
Can you please explain what is the point of swapping `n` and `m` here and in the `drop_drop`?
This was changed some time ago in the List API, and I wanted to keep List and Stream' consistent
aligning to the `List` API seems a reasonable thing to do
This is the same as `Stream'.eta` defined above. From its limited usage in this file, it seems that it is often used in the opposite direction, so it probably shouldn't be a `simp` lemma.
Again, the analogous lemma for List is simp, so doesn't the same apply there?

You should probably do the following instead:

```
@[simp]
protected theorem eta (s : Stream' Î±) : (head s::tail s) = s :=
  funext fun i => by cases i <;> rfl

/-- Alias for `Stream'.eta` to match `List` API. -/
alias cons_head_tail := Stream'.eta
```
The more canonical way to express this is via `Function.Injective2`, as in `cons_injective2`, `cons_injective_left`, and `cons_injective_right` above.
`Injective2` doesn't hold: The length assumption in `append_right_injective` cannot be dropped
Sven seems to be right here. But as far as I understand this should be `append_left_injective `, see comment above.

There are plenty of statements in this file that use a different order of these variables. Therefore I don't think putting them at the top is a good idea. Rather, I would specifically use `variable` for certain sections where all statements use them in the same order and explicitness. (like before `get_append_left` on line 453)

```suggestion
lemma append_right_injective : Function.Injective (x ++â‚› Â·) := by
  intro a b h
  ext n; replace h := congr_arg (fun a â†¦ a.get (x.length + n)) h; simpa using h
```

compare to `List.append_right_injective`. (arguably, I think it should be `List.append_injective_right` but that's out-of-scope here)

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma append_right_inj : x ++â‚› a = x ++â‚› b â†” a = b :=
```
I'm not sure about policy. Does mathlib favour one of the two? Probably not important anyways
Probably older than omega

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add stream' lemmas
